client

Class ServerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.ServerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Date: 30-05-2020 This class implements the thread through which the client will communicate with the server With the contribution of TABOU Metagang
    Author:
    JATOB Nicolas

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerThread

        public ServerThread(java.net.Socket socket,
                    java.lang.String userName,
                    client.AES encryptor,
                    gui.GUI clientGUI)
             throws java.io.IOException
        This method instantiates objects of this class
        Parameters:
        socket - Socket object to establish a connection
        userName - String value to hold the name of the user
        encryptor - AES object to encrypt the user's message unique to each user
        clientGUI - GUI object received from the client starting this thread
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error sent by the AES object cipher and decipher method

    • Method Detail

      • addNextMessage

        public void addNextMessage(java.lang.String message)
        This method adds a message to the list of messages to be sent
        Parameters:
        message - string value which holds the message to be sent

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is the actual runnable method of the class, it uses the connection established in the client class. It will set up the different I/O streams used to send data to the server Then it runs indefinitely to send any input of the user to the server
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
